content:
I do not have personal experiences, but i can tell you that teams with fast guards can utilize their speed to create advantages on offense in the following ways:

1. fast breaks: guards with speed can beat the opposing team's defenders down the court to create fast breaks leading to easy baskets.

2. pick-and-rolls: speedy guards can catch defenders off-guard on pick-and-roll plays, allowing them to quickly attack the basket or create open shots for teammates.

3. dribble penetration: fast guards with good ball-handling skills can penetrate the defense with ease, creating scoring opportunities for themselves or their teammates.

4. transition offense: teams with fast guards can push the pace of the game and attack the defense before they have a chance to set up, leading to easier baskets.

5. creating mismatches: fast guards can use their quickness to create mismatches against slower defenders, either by getting past them or pulling them away from the basket.

6. changing directions: agile guards can use quick changes of direction to elude defenders and create space for themselves or their teammates.

overall, teams with fast guards can create a lot of chaos and unpredictability on the offensive end of the court, which can make them very difficult to defend.
